page.title: 05Naming the Mumbles Lifeboat
page.content: On July 3rd 1985 Mumbles Lifeboat was named by HRH the Duke of Kent. He named her"Ethel Anne Measures".Mrs. Heard took Victoria & Fiona to see this new Lifeboat being named.The Mumbles Lifeboat station & the Coastguard station have been waiting for 4 years for a new Lifeboat and at last local people have managed to raise enough money,Â£230,000.The Duke arrived by helicopter & car at 11:00, half an hour late.Then we had a service for the lifeboatmen.Around 12:00 the Duke made his speech & then smashed the champagne against the starboard bows.The lifeboat was named after Ethel Anne Measures who gave Â£200,000 towards it.We interviewed a lifeboatman & he said that the new boat was faster,better equipped & had more room.He has been in the crew for 3 years.by Fiona Court& Victoria Moore
